intro: Lonicera tatarica var. parvifolia, commonly known as the Tatarian honeysuckle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features opposite, ovate leaves that are typically smaller and more pointed than those of the standard Lonicera tatarica. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. The plant is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of nectar for pollinators.
